episode: Around the same time every month, I have a co-worker who will ask me for a specific request.  I prepare myself so the request doesn't take me much time.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: At work, I can create reports using the data that I have access to.  My coworkers are supposed to know how to do this themselves, but they will come to me instead to ask for help.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That can be frustrating, feeling like you're being relied on too heavily.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I agree.  There is one particular coworker who comes to me on the 15th of every month.  I have learned to anticipate her request and start generating the report for her.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It sounds like you're enabling her a bit, taking away her incentive to learn.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: That's true.  I could be doing that.  I just feel I am not in the position to turn her down.  I feel it could be used against me.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Politics at play, you're worried about repercussions.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Exactly.  That why I try to anticipate people's requests.  I want things done with little difficulty.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: So you're trying to maintain a smooth workflow and avoid conflict.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yes. I am also trying to set things up for the report so I won't have to waste too much of my valuable time.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Efficiency is key, minimizing the time spent on others' tasks.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Exactly.  There are other people beside this one co-worker who seem to ask for help around the same times as well.  I may have a talk with my boss about limiting these requests.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Good idea, maybe your boss can help set boundaries or delegate tasks more evenly.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I just don't want to be seen as someone who is combative or turning down work.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: You want to approach it in a way that's solution-focused, not negative or resistant.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Correct.  I feel there should be no negativity associated with me turning down these tasks.  However, until I get to that point, I try to be organized so I can efficiently finish the tasks for my coworkers.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Being proactive and organized helps you maintain a positive image while setting the stage for future changes.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yes.  I have to be careful of letting this go for too long.  What was once something that I did as a favor can quickly become a "responsibility".

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Boundaries can blur quickly, and favors can become expectations.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I want others to keep their expectations as low as possible for me.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Smart, managing others' expectations to maintain your own workload and sanity.
